reference.title: Glossary
reference.shortdesc: This page contains a description of keywords used throughout the document.

ul.li: Share: to grant or give a share in —often used with with
Fullscreen: occupy the whole computer screen
Print: make physical copy of the document using a printer
Undo: go to a previous state
Clipboard: If you copy(Ctrl + C) content, it is being held on the “Clipboard” for you to paste(Ctrl + V) at your convenience
Symbols: Something that stands for something else. A representation.
Shape: A geometric figure such as a square, triangle, or rectangle These can all be inserted into a OneNote page.
Ink to Text: Converting drawn words into typed text.
Pen: One of the drawing tools that can be used in OneNote.
Table: A container that can hold data in an organized manner
Pages: An area in OneNote that holds all content. Multiple paged can be open at once.
Notebook: A notebook can be created in OneNote to hold multiple pages that may or may not be related to each other for ease of access.
Section: A smaller area on a page that can hold certain content. A page can be broken up into multiple sections
Search: OneNote allows users to search for specific content using a search bar.
Audio: Audio clips can be inserted into a page in OneNote.
File: You can save a OneNote file for later use at any time.
Printout: Users can print out their notes to have a physical copy of them if need be.
Meetings: Users can organize and take notes for a meeting in OneNote.
Math: OneNote is able to solve either typed or drawn math problems
Draw Notes: OneNote provides the option to draw notes rather than type them
Clipping: OneNote provides the option to clip an area from another page and insert it into a page.
Date and Time: OneNote gives the option to insert the date and/or time onto a page.
Stickers: There are many preset stickers that can be inserted into a page.
Immersive Reader: a full screen reading experience to increase readability of content in OneNote documents.
Help: The help menu can be opened at any time to help solve a problem a user may be having.
Translate: Text can be translated to another language in OneNote
Zoom: A page and be zoomed in and out for ease of use/work.
Lines: Lines can be inserted into pages to divide sections of to create anything that one desires.
Replay: A drawing can be replayed after it is drawn if a user desires.
